body.p: To address these issues, and for the reasons given in paragraphs BC4.6–BC4.18, the Board revised the definitions to read as follows:

li.p: an asset is a present economic resource controlled by the entity as a result of past events;
a liability is a present obligation of the entity to transfer an economic resource as a result of past events; and
an economic resource is a right that has the potential to produce economic benefits.
